summary: This is a letter from the Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office to the Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office, responding to a public records request and providing access to the state's complete, unredacted investigative and prosecutorial files on Jeffrey Epstein, totaling thousands of pages and multimedia items.

persons.name: David Aronberg
persons.context: He is the State Attorney for the Fifteenth Judicial Circuit in and for Palm Beach County, Florida, and his office is responding to the records request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document states the provided records concern the investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Aronberg's office (State Attorney) was responsible for the state-level investigation and prosecution of Epstein, as evidenced by them holding the case files.

events.title: Records Request Received
events.description: The Southern District of New York's request for unredacted state files on the Epstein investigation was received by the Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office.

events.title: Records Response Provided
events.description: The Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office completed its response, providing electronic access to the complete, unredacted state files on the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office provided its entire, unredacted investigative and prosecutorial files on Jeffrey Epstein to the Southern District of New York in September 2020.
The provided records were extensive, consisting of 4,421 pages of information, 43 audio files, and 6 video files.
The document indicates coordination between state (Florida) and federal (New York) authorities in the Epstein investigations.
The response was to a public records request identified as No. 2020PR000426AMB.
The files included two pages of 'Case Relationships' retrieved from the office's electronic Stac database system.
